You follow Kambralyn west...

[Hope's Path.]

The path of four leaf clove shaped flagstones leads past a small clean shack and into a well formed tunnel through the thorn bushes to the east and the Caersech to the west. The small shack is set back from the road, its walls built of a whitewashed birch. A sturdy corral, filled with well-fed horses, stands to the left of the shack. A matched pair of dapple grays stand in front of the shack waiting to take their human baggage to their destination. To the left of the door, behind a small paned window, a beautiful Fir Elf female takes coin and in return, with a charming smile, directs those who have paid their fare into the waiting room.  A small shack, a freshly painted sign, a notice of non-refund, and a small winding stone pathway are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian, Ariella the Anthian, Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: northeast* east* southwest* northwest*.

You follow Kambralyn northwest...

[Hope's Path.]

A small path, its stones in the shape of four leaf clovers, winds its way through the sparse remains of a once dense undergrowth. New plants and flowers begin to rise from the blackened floor, bringing a new color and life to the area.  A small winding stone pathway and a mossy cracked steelwood tree are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian, Ariella the Anthian, Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: north* southeast* southwest*.

You follow Kambralyn north...

[Hope's Path.]

A fine haze of dust hovers over the remains of the Silver Owl Inn. Through the fallen timbers and memories of lives lost, one can see brilliant green sprouts reaching for sunlight. A tiny songbird perches on an old stick of furniture poking through the rubble, singing sweetly to herald new life and hope. A small winding path of stones placed in the shape of four leaf clovers winds itself through the forest.  A small winding stone pathway and a charred flowering steelwood tree are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian, Ariella the Anthian, Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: northeast* south* northwest*.

You follow Kambralyn northwest...

[Hope's Path.]

Once dead and blackened trees now come to life with spots of moss and growth. A patch of wild mushrooms grows at the base of one of the trees. Small, four-leaf-clover shaped stones, form a small path through the area. The soft sound of running water echoes in from the west.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian, Ariella the Anthian, Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: east* southeast* west*.

You follow Kambralyn west...

[Hope's Path.]

A small stream runs noisily under the two bridges spanning the ravine. A number of the brunt oaks still stand about, memorials to the forest this once was. A number of small saplings dot the ground between the black trunks. Between the stream bank and oaks, a small path of four-leaf-clover shaped stones weave a windy path through the forest.  A stone bridge, a wooden bridge, a clump of wildgrass, and some flowering jasmine vines are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian, Ariella the Anthian, Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: east*.

You follow Kambralyn through a stone bridge...

[Caersech Forest.]

The western bank is steep and rocky. In some places, it has collapsed, exposing the immense roots of the oaks nearest the stream. The stream widens and its waters become deeper. The gentle flow has become a strong current.   A stone bridge is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian, Ariella the Anthian, Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: west* northwest*.

You follow Kambralyn west...

[Caersech Forest.]

An ancient oak tree towers above the forest floor, covering the surrounding landscape beneath its branches. The natural buzz of the recovering forest is barely audible above the rush of the rapidly moving river. Small grasses and wildflowers poke through the leaf-covered ground.  An oak tree and a broken and cracked steelwood tree are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian, Ariella the Anthian, Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* west* northwest*.

You follow Kambralyn west...

[Caersech Forest.]

Emerging from the dark grove, the trail ends abruptly. The stream tumbles over a sheer cliff and into the ravine below as it sweeps through from the northeast, its waters raging against the chasm walls. Dark shadows from the forest and cave below have begun to expand and swarm the area.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian, Ariella the Anthian, Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east*.

You follow Kambralyn through a rotting hemp rope...

[Ravine.]

A narrow strip of mud separates the cliff face from the churning waters at the bottom of the falls. A misty spray soaks this path that terminates at a deep blue pool to the south. Continuing north, the path disappears into a muddy bog.  A rotting hemp rope and a muddy path to the bog are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian, Ariella the Anthian, Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: south*.

You follow Kambralyn through a muddy path to the bog...

[Muddy Bog.]

A bog spreads out to the north and east, sheltered by the high walls of a ravine. The western edge of the bog melts into a deep lake fed by a rushing waterfall. Beside the path, an ancient snapping turtle rises to the surface of a stagnant muddy pool. After a brief breath of air, he disappears into the murky depths.  A path to the waterfall is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian, Ariella the Anthian, Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: northwest*.

[Muddy Bog.]

Leafy tree branches hang so low that they rest on the surface of the scummy water. Brightly colored dragonflies dart between them, their glistening bodies a welcome change to the brown, murky bog. The clearer water of the lake drifts in from the west, keeping the bog moist all year round.  An open enchanting pouch is here.

[Muddy Bog.]

Thick, slimy bubbles emerge to the surface of the deep bog and burst with a sickening sound that startles the prey of a nearby snake into hopping away at the last second. Low-hanging cypress branches shade the already dark waters, making them appear much more sinister than the surrounding bog. Somehow life still must go on here,as the splashing of fish diving beneath the exposed roots of the trees can still be heard.

[Muddy Bog.]

A rotting log, home to several winged insects, spans a large pool of murky water that lies between the limestone walls of the ravine. It looks stable enough to support a significant amount of weight, and judging by the air bubbles that rise to the surface of the murky water at regular intervals, it is probably best to keep ones extremities above the water level in this boggy marsh.  A long rotting log is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Muddy Bog.]

Thick, slimy bubbles emerge to the surface of the deep bog and burst with a sickening sound that startles the prey of a nearby snake into hopping away at the last second. Low-hanging cypress branches shade the already dark waters, making them appear much more sinister than the surrounding bog. Somehow life still must go on here,as the splashing of fish diving beneath the exposed roots of the trees can still be heard.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st black marsh alligator.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 15 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.

[Muddy Bog.]

Long tendrils of dark green moss drape from hanging branches. The curtain of ancient cypress obscures the view deeper into the bog. Brushing them aside only reveals more cypress and stringy moss. Strange birds call to each other from deep within the trees, but the most that can be seen are a few ruddy feathers.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st water crule and the 1st black marsh alligator.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* southwest* west* northwest*.
tact
Standing in front of you at 3 UDs, is:
water crule
Standing in front of you at 2 UDs, is:
Kambralyn
Standing in front of you at 1 UDs, is:
Orianna, Ariella, Kithrael, black marsh alligator
Standing in this rank is:
Muther
Standing behind you at 4 UDs, is:
Clive
>
Orianna fires her detailed unicorn-etched duskwood recurve bow at the black marsh alligator!
The shot is a good blow to the left arm.

Kambralyn fires her green and black feathered ash crossbow at the black marsh alligator!
The shot misses its target.

Kithrael's fingertips begin to glow with a pale green light.

Clive fires his emerald inlaid mahogany crossbow at the black marsh alligator!
The shot is a decent blow to the torso.

The bluish glow spreads out and soothingly envelops Ariella's body!

The bluish glow upon Ariella's fingertips slowly fades away.

A pale, bluish glow surrounds Ariella's fingertips.

The black marsh alligator's skin pales as the green light spreads across the surface of its body!

The pale green glow upon Kithrael's fingertips fades away.

The water crule advances towards Kithrael.

The black marsh alligator turns and runs southwest!
diag all

  You examine Orianna the Anthian...
She has no apparent injuries, but looks fatigued.
  You examine Ariella the Anthian...
She has a tiny puncture wound in her left leg, and looks weakened and fatigued.
  You examine Kambralyn the Fir Elf...
She has a medium sized puncture wound in her left arm, and looks weakened and tired.
  You examine Kithrael the Fir Elf...
He has a tiny slash across his left leg, and looks weakened and fatigued.
  You examine Clive the Drag-al...
He has no apparent injuries, but looks weakened.

>
Orianna fires her detailed unicorn-etched duskwood recurve bow at the water crule!
The shot is a well-delivered blow to the left arm.
    The water crule is knocked back!

You follow Kambralyn southwest...

[Muddy Bog.]

A rotting log, home to several winged insects, spans a large pool of murky water that lies between the limestone walls of the ravine. It looks stable enough to support a significant amount of weight, and judging by the air bubbles that rise to the surface of the murky water at regular intervals, it is probably best to keep ones extremities above the water level in this boggy marsh.  A long rotting log, a tarnished silver halberd, and a tarnished steel chainmail coif are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st black marsh alligator.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.

Clive fires his emerald inlaid mahogany crossbow at the black marsh alligator!
The shot is a strong blow to the torso.

The black marsh alligator just died.

The bluish glow spreads out and soothingly envelops Ariella's body!

The bluish glow upon Ariella's fingertips slowly fades away.

It looks stable enough to support a significant amount of weight, and judging by the air bubbles that rise to the surface of the murky water at regular intervals, it is probably best to keep ones extremities above the water level in this boggy marsh.  A long rotting log, a tarnished silver halberd, a tarnished steel chainmail coif, and a closed beautiful gold chest are here.

You follow Kambralyn northeast...

[Muddy Bog.]

A rocky path skirts the base of a sheer limestone cliff. Despite the unstable footing on the loose stone, this path is far quicker than slogging through the dangerous bog. Tiny pebbles click against the trail as they lose their place in the rock wall, leaving small niches in the jagged surface. To the northwest, the size of the fallen rocks is noticeably larger.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st molting crule and the 2nd molting crule.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

Elindalian wildflowers begin to blossom all around Muther!
Weaving those runes cost you 4 FPs.

You feel more tired.
[11 sec. delay]

Your god is pleased with you!

The shot is a decent blow to the head.

[Muddy Bog.]

A rocky path skirts the base of a sheer limestone cliff. Despite the unstable footing on the loose stone, this path is far quicker than slogging through the dangerous bog. Tiny pebbles click against the trail as they lose their place in the rock wall, leaving small niches in the jagged surface. To the northwest, the size of the fallen rocks is noticeably larger.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st molting crule corpse and the 2nd molting crule corpse.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.

[Muddy Bog.]

As the elevation drops to the west, this muddy bog gives way to a large lake. Clear paths are visible along the walls of the ravine to both the southwest and northwest, venturing to the center of the bog will require careful foot placement to avoid the stagnant pools and deep muck. Walking through the dark waters that pools atop the sludge beneath can prove dangerous for even the most sure-footed hunter.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st molting crule.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: east* west* northwest*.

Wisps of shimmering blue mist begin to trail from Kithrael fingertips.

You follow Kambralyn northwest...

[Muddy Bog.]

A rocky path skirts the base of a sheer limestone cliff. Despite the unstable footing on the loose stone, this path is far quicker than slogging through the dangerous bog. Tiny pebbles click against the trail as they lose their place in the rock wall, leaving small niches in the jagged surface. To the northwest, the size of the fallen rocks is noticeably larger.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

You follow Kambralyn west...

[Muddy Bog.]

The rock strewn path gives way to cool, spongy earth as one heads into the bog. Tiny insects with paddle-shaped appendages dance across the surface of some standing water as tall grasses sway to and fro with the breeze. Deep in the bog, a piercing cry is quickly silenced as some unfortunate animal meets its fate by either being swallowed up in the muck or being attacked by the bog's more ferocious creatures.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st black marsh alligator.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: north* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Muddy Bog.]

To the west, the brilliantly clear waters of the lake glitter with schools of leaping silverback fish. The view is a startling contrast to the ominously dark waters that make up the home for the bog's denizens. Even the bird nesting in nearby cypress trees seem depressed when they lean their heads down to clean the mud off their feet. The view east seems darker still as the bog waters deepen into blackness.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

You follow Kambralyn west...

[Muddy Bog.]

A subtle under-current pulls the standing reeds to lean slightly south with their leaves trailing down into the water. A large rock lizard flicks its tongue into the air as it scuttles up onto a large rock in pursuit of its dinner. Parts of the rock seem to move as the lizard abruptly vanishes into its depths. After a brief silence following a large gulping sound, the cacaphony of insects returns to its normal volume.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st molting crule.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.

[Muddy Bog.]

Several painted arrow shafts stick up out of the path at crazy angles, suggesting some kind of crude hunter's marker.  Why anyone would want to mark a path through the edge of the bog is anyone's guess. The leafy shoot of an oak tree has a pitiful hold in the ground with its roots almost completely exposed.  A family of beetles has taken residence under its branches and made a hearty meal from the lower leaves.  Some broken blackened acorns are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st rock crule and the 1st molting crule.

[Muddy Bog.]

A furry, raccoon-like animal scrambles to free his back legs from the mud and get back into the cleaner fishing waters.  A lizard drowsing on some nearby rocks watches the animal's movements intensely, twitching its tail. The path that snakes around the the east is hard to make out, making it easy to wander toward the deeper waters if one is not careful.

[Muddy Bog.]

To the west, the brilliantly clear waters of the lake glitter with schools of leaping silverback fish. The view is a startling contrast to the ominously dark waters that make up the home for the bog's denizens. Even the bird nesting in nearby cypress trees seem depressed when they lean their heads down to clean the mud off their feet. The view east seems darker still as the bog waters deepen into blackness.

This area is illuminated.

[Muddy Bog.]

A subtle under-current pulls the standing reeds to lean slightly south with their leaves trailing down into the water. A large rock lizard flicks its tongue into the air as it scuttles up onto a large rock in pursuit of its dinner. Parts of the rock seem to move as the lizard abruptly vanishes into its depths. After a brief silence following a large gulping sound, the cacaphony of insects returns to its normal volume.

To the west, the brilliantly clear waters of the lake glitter with schools of leaping silverback fish. The view is a startling contrast to the ominously dark waters that make up the home for the bog's denizens. Even the bird nesting in nearby cypress trees seem depressed when they lean their heads down to clean the mud off their feet. The view east seems darker still as the bog waters deepen into blackness.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st black marsh alligator.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

You have no apparent injuries, but look tired.

HP: 163/163  Ftg:  53/ 64

The bluish glow upon Ariella's fingertips slowly fades away.

You follow Kambralyn south...

[Muddy Bog.]

Muddy footprints lead from the deeper waters of the bog up toward the edge of the muck.  Oddly enough, there are no footprints coming the other way, as if some large creature crawled out of the sludge to shore. Tiny winged insects buzz all around you, creating eerie harmonies with their wings. Cypress leaves are scattered all throughout the area, with some floating lazily in the waters and others stuck comically atop mounds of mud.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st black marsh alligator.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

The black marsh alligator's skin pales as the green light spreads across the surface of its body!

The pale green glow upon Kithrael's fingertips fades away.

The black marsh alligator just died.

[Muddy Bog.]

Thick, slimy bubbles emerge to the surface of the deep bog and burst with a sickening sound that startles the prey of a nearby snake into hopping away at the last second. Low-hanging cypress branches shade the already dark waters, making them appear much more sinister than the surrounding bog. Somehow life still must go on here,as the splashing of fish diving beneath the exposed roots of the trees can still be heard.

This area is illuminated.

[Muddy Bog.]

A rotting log, home to several winged insects, spans a large pool of murky water that lies between the limestone walls of the ravine. It looks stable enough to support a significant amount of weight, and judging by the air bubbles that rise to the surface of the murky water at regular intervals, it is probably best to keep ones extremities above the water level in this boggy marsh. [Muddy Bog.]

The murky waters of the bog deepen here, and continue to do so to the east, making any movement on foot a sluggish task. Scraggly moss dangles from low hanging cypress trees, providing as yet another obstacle to overcome within the murk. Insects chirp and trill from every angle, almost disguising the low baying of a strange animal nearby; a threat or a warning?  Some stooped cypress trees and some low hanging moss are here.

[Muddy Bog.]

As the sounds of the waterfall echo from the southeast, the waters of the lake glimmer in the available light, and the boggy air lightens up considerably. Across the lake to the north and west, the dense green forest rises, and the hoots and calls of various forest creatures becomes faintly apparent against the soothing background noise of the running water.

This area is illuminated.

[Muddy Bog.]

A rotting log, home to several winged insects, spans a large pool of murky water that lies between the limestone walls of the ravine. It looks stable enough to support a significant amount of weight, and judging by the air bubbles that rise to the surface of the murky water at regular intervals, it is probably best to keep ones extremities above the water level in this boggy marsh. [Muddy Bog.]

Leafy tree branches hang so low that they rest on the surface of the scummy water. Brightly colored dragonflies dart between them, their glistening bodies a welcome change to the brown, murky bog. The clearer water of the lake drifts in from the west, keeping the bog moist all year round.

This area is illuminated.

[Muddy Bog.]

As the sounds of the waterfall echo from the southeast, the waters of the lake glimmer in the available light, and the boggy air lightens up considerably. [Muddy Bog.]

The murky waters of the bog deepen here, and continue to do so to the east, making any movement on foot a sluggish task. Scraggly moss dangles from low hanging cypress trees, providing as yet another obstacle to overcome within the murk. Insects chirp and trill from every angle, almost disguising the low baying of a strange animal nearby; a threat or a warning?  Some stooped cypress trees and some low hanging moss are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.

[Muddy Bog.]

Muddy footprints lead from the deeper waters of the bog up toward the edge of the muck.  Oddly enough, there are no footprints coming the other way, as if some large creature crawled out of the sludge to shore. Tiny winged insects buzz all around you, creating eerie harmonies with their wings. Cypress leaves are scattered all throughout the area, with some floating lazily in the waters and others stuck comically atop mounds of mud.  An open baggy leather sack is here.

[Muddy Bog.]

A finger and a sandaled foot, both cast in stone, lie amongst the rocks and pebbles that have fallen from the cliffside. Kicking aside a few of the smaller pieces of limestone reveals more bits of a shattered statue, her marbled face worn by time into a grim mask. The statue must have been placed in ancient times before the area was flooded.  A broken regal marble huntress statue is here.

[Muddy Bog.]

A well worn path clings to the base of the ravine wall, the riot of reeds and rushes threatening to claim it. Recently laid deer tracks come to an abrupt end at a site of obvious struggle. The bent stalks of marsh grasses indicate the direction the unlucky animal was dragged, with bits of bloody fur littering its path. On the ravine wall, some jokester has written in fading chalk, "No swimming allowed."

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st rock crule corpse.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.

[Muddy Bog.]

Long tendrils of dark green moss drape from hanging branches. The curtain of ancient cypress obscures the view deeper into the bog. Brushing them aside only reveals more cypress and stringy moss. Strange birds call to each other from deep within the trees, but the most that can be seen are a few ruddy feathers.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.

Kithrael fidgets.

You follow Kambralyn northwest...

[Muddy Bog.]

Muddy footprints lead from the deeper waters of the bog up toward the edge of the muck.  Oddly enough, there are no footprints coming the other way, as if some large creature crawled out of the sludge to shore. Tiny winged insects buzz all around you, creating eerie harmonies with their wings. Cypress leaves are scattered all throughout the area, with some floating lazily in the waters and others stuck comically atop mounds of mud.  An open baggy leather sack and a tomato stained chef's apron are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.

[Muddy Bog.]

A subtle under-current pulls the standing reeds to lean slightly south with their leaves trailing down into the water. A large rock lizard flicks its tongue into the air as it scuttles up onto a large rock in pursuit of its dinner. Parts of the rock seem to move as the lizard abruptly vanishes into its depths. After a brief silence following a large gulping sound, the cacaphony of insects returns to its normal volume.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west*.

You follow Kambralyn north...

[Muddy Bog.]

A furry, raccoon-like animal scrambles to free his back legs from the mud and get back into the cleaner fishing waters.  A lizard drowsing on some nearby rocks watches the animal's movements intensely, twitching its tail. The path that snakes around the the east is hard to make out, making it easy to wander toward the deeper waters if one is not careful.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st black marsh alligator.

[Muddy Bog.]

Long tendrils of dark green moss drape from hanging branches. The curtain of ancient cypress obscures the view deeper into the bog. Brushing them aside only reveals more cypress and stringy moss. Strange birds call to each other from deep within the trees, but the most that can be seen are a few ruddy feathers.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st black marsh alligator corpse, the 2nd black marsh alligator, and the 1st rock crule.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf (seated), and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Muddy Bog.]

A rocky path skirts the base of a sheer limestone cliff. Despite the unstable footing on the loose stone, this path is far quicker than slogging through the dangerous bog. Tiny pebbles click against the trail as they lose their place in the rock wall, leaving small niches in the jagged surface. To the northwest, the size of the fallen rocks is noticeably larger.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st rock crule.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.

You follow Kambralyn southwest...

[Muddy Bog.]

Long tendrils of dark green moss drape from hanging branches. The curtain of ancient cypress obscures the view deeper into the bog. Brushing them aside only reveals more cypress and stringy moss. Strange birds call to each other from deep within the trees, but the most that can be seen are a few ruddy feathers.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

You follow Kambralyn south...

[Muddy Bog.]

The footing is more stable beside the walls of the chasm, though the risk of falling rock is greater. A rusting sword blade peeks out from beneath one side of a particularly large boulder, a rotting leather boot is partially visible beneath the other side. Even an Oog-ra could determine what happened to this poor soul.  A giant limestone boulder is here.

This area is illuminated.

You follow Kambralyn northwest...

[Muddy Bog.]

Thick, slimy bubbles emerge to the surface of the deep bog and burst with a sickening sound that startles the prey of a nearby snake into hopping away at the last second. Low-hanging cypress branches shade the already dark waters, making them appear much more sinister than the surrounding bog. Somehow life still must go on here,as the splashing of fish diving beneath the exposed roots of the trees can still be heard.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

You follow Kambralyn north...

[Muddy Bog.]

Muddy footprints lead from the deeper waters of the bog up toward the edge of the muck.  Oddly enough, there are no footprints coming the other way, as if some large creature crawled out of the sludge to shore. Tiny winged insects buzz all around you, creating eerie harmonies with their wings. Cypress leaves are scattered all throughout the area, with some floating lazily in the waters and others stuck comically atop mounds of mud.  A tomato stained chef's apron is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st molting crule and the 1st black marsh alligator corpse.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, Netraa the Leuian, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.

[Muddy Bog.]

The rock strewn path gives way to cool, spongy earth as one heads into the bog. Tiny insects with paddle-shaped appendages dance across the surface of some standing water as tall grasses sway to and fro with the breeze. Deep in the bog, a piercing cry is quickly silenced as some unfortunate animal meets its fate by either being swallowed up in the muck or being attacked by the bog's more ferocious creatures.

As the sounds of the waterfall echo from the southeast, the waters of the lake glimmer in the available light, and the boggy air lightens up considerably. [Muddy Bog.]

Travel through the deep-bog is rather difficult at this section as the thick, sludgy water is as high as a human's waist. Some fallen, rotting logs jut up from underneath, providing needed handholds. Glittering yellow eyes sparkle for a brief moment in a low branch of the cypress trees.  A twisted mossy oak tree stump, a small radiant agate figurine, and an open baggy leather sack are here.

[Muddy Bog.]

l
To the west, the brilliantly clear waters of the lake glitter with schools of leaping silverback fish. The view is a startling contrast to the ominously dark waters that make up the home for the bog's denizens. Even the bird nesting in nearby cypress trees seem depressed when they lean their heads down to clean the mud off their feet. The view east seems darker still as the bog waters deepen into blackness.

[Muddy Bog.]

The sparkling lake and the slowly eroding limestone cliff wall meet at this northeast corner of the bog. [Muddy Bog.]

To the west, the brilliantly clear waters of the lake glitter with schools of leaping silverback fish. The view is a startling contrast to the ominously dark waters that make up the home for the bog's denizens. Even the bird nesting in nearby cypress trees seem depressed when they lean their heads down to clean the mud off their feet. The view east seems darker still as the bog waters deepen into blackness.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st molting crule and the 2nd molting crule.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Muddy Bog.]

A finger and a sandaled foot, both cast in stone, lie amongst the rocks and pebbles that have fallen from the cliffside. Kicking aside a few of the smaller pieces of limestone reveals more bits of a shattered statue, her marbled face worn by time into a grim mask. The statue must have been placed in ancient times before the area was flooded.  A broken regal marble huntress statue is here.

[Muddy Bog.]

Muddy footprints lead from the deeper waters of the bog up toward the edge of the muck.  Oddly enough, there are no footprints coming the other way, as if some large creature crawled out of the sludge to shore. Tiny winged insects buzz all around you, creating eerie harmonies with their wings. Cypress leaves are scattered all throughout the area, with some floating lazily in the waters and others stuck comically atop mounds of mud.  A tomato stained chef's apron is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st black marsh alligator corpse.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Muddy Bog.]

A subtle under-current pulls the standing reeds to lean slightly south with their leaves trailing down into the water. A large rock lizard flicks its tongue into the air as it scuttles up onto a large rock in pursuit of its dinner. Parts of the rock seem to move as the lizard abruptly vanishes into its depths. After a brief silence following a large gulping sound, the cacaphony of insects returns to its normal volume.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west*.

You follow Kambralyn northeast...

[Muddy Bog.]

The bog is less murky at this juncture, with the cleaner waters of the lake cleansing the mud beneath.  Even some silverback fishes feed near some floating logs, their backs arching grafully as they leap out as the baby dragonflies that buzz overhead. The vegetation that covers the logs are noticeably healthier than the scraggly trees that inhabit the rest of the bog.  Some rotting mossy sprout-covered logs are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: east* southeast* south* southwest* west*.

[Muddy Bog.]

To the west, the brilliantly clear waters of the lake glitter with schools of leaping silverback fish. The view is a startling contrast to the ominously dark waters that make up the home for the bog's denizens. Even the bird nesting in nearby cypress trees seem depressed when they lean their heads down to clean the mud off their feet. The view east seems darker still as the bog waters deepen into blackness.  A pair of dark brown orkskin gloves are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.

You follow Kambralyn south...

[Muddy Bog.]

Muddy footprints lead from the deeper waters of the bog up toward the edge of the muck.  Oddly enough, there are no footprints coming the other way, as if some large creature crawled out of the sludge to shore. Tiny winged insects buzz all around you, creating eerie harmonies with their wings. Cypress leaves are scattered all throughout the area, with some floating lazily in the waters and others stuck comically atop mounds of mud.  A tomato stained chef's apron and an open stained lionskin sack are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

You follow Kambralyn south...

[Muddy Bog.]

Thick, slimy bubbles emerge to the surface of the deep bog and burst with a sickening sound that startles the prey of a nearby snake into hopping away at the last second. Low-hanging cypress branches shade the already dark waters, making them appear much more sinister than the surrounding bog. Somehow life still must go on here,as the splashing of fish diving beneath the exposed roots of the trees can still be heard.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

Clive slings his emerald inlaid mahogany crossbow.

You follow Kambralyn south...

[Muddy Bog.]

A rotting log, home to several winged insects, spans a large pool of murky water that lies between the limestone walls of the ravine. It looks stable enough to support a significant amount of weight, and judging by the air bubbles that rise to the surface of the murky water at regular intervals, it is probably best to keep ones extremities above the water level in this boggy marsh.  A long rotting log and a closed filthy pouch are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st black marsh alligator corpse.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.

Clive readies a short finely carved bone skinning blade.

Kambralyn slings her green and black feathered ash crossbow.

Kambralyn readies a short jade-hilted unicorn-etched platinum skinning knife.

Clive examines the the black marsh alligator closely, and attempts to skin it...
  With a few skillful motions, he salvages some hide.

The black marsh alligator turns to dust.

Kambralyn glances at the closed filthy pouch.
diag all

  You examine Orianna the Anthian...
She has no apparent injuries, but looks tired.
  You examine Ariella the Anthian...
She has no apparent injuries, but looks tired.
  You examine Kambralyn the Fir Elf...
She appears to be in perfect health.
  You examine Kithrael the Fir Elf...
He has a tiny puncture wound in his torso, and looks weakened and tired.
  You examine Clive the Drag-al...
He has no apparent injuries, but looks tired.

[Muddy Bog.]

Thick, slimy bubbles emerge to the surface of the deep bog and burst with a sickening sound that startles the prey of a nearby snake into hopping away at the last second. Low-hanging cypress branches shade the already dark waters, making them appear much more sinister than the surrounding bog. Somehow life still must go on here,as the splashing of fish diving beneath the exposed roots of the trees can still be heard.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st molting crule corpse and the 2nd molting crule corpse.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.

[Muddy Bog.]

A rotting log, home to several winged insects, spans a large pool of murky water that lies between the limestone walls of the ravine. It looks stable enough to support a significant amount of weight, and judging by the air bubbles that rise to the surface of the murky water at regular intervals, it is probably best to keep ones extremities above the water level in this boggy marsh.  A long rotting log is here.

[Muddy Bog.]

A rusting sword blade peeks out from beneath one side of a particularly large boulder, a rotting leather boot is partially visible beneath the other side. [Muddy Bog.]

A well worn path clings to the base of the ravine wall, the riot of reeds and rushes threatening to claim it. Recently laid deer tracks come to an abrupt end at a site of obvious struggle. The bent stalks of marsh grasses indicate the direction the unlucky animal was dragged, with bits of bloody fur littering its path. On the ravine wall, some jokester has written in fading chalk, "No swimming allowed."

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st black marsh alligator and the 2nd black marsh alligator.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.

[Muddy Bog.]

As the elevation drops to the west, this muddy bog gives way to a large lake. Clear paths are visible along the walls of the ravine to both the southwest and northwest, venturing to the center of the bog will require careful foot placement to avoid the stagnant pools and deep muck. Walking through the dark waters that pools atop the sludge beneath can prove dangerous for even the most sure-footed hunter.

This area is illuminated.

[Muddy Bog.]

A rocky path skirts the base of a sheer limestone cliff. Despite the unstable footing on the loose stone, this path is far quicker than slogging through the dangerous bog. Tiny pebbles click against the trail as they lose their place in the rock wall, leaving small niches in the jagged surface. To the northwest, the size of the fallen rocks is noticeably larger.

[Muddy Bog.]

Muddy footprints lead from the deeper waters of the bog up toward the edge of the muck.  Oddly enough, there are no footprints coming the other way, as if some large creature crawled out of the sludge to shore. Tiny winged insects buzz all around you, creating eerie harmonies with their wings. Cypress leaves are scattered all throughout the area, with some floating lazily in the waters and others stuck comically atop mounds of mud.

This area is illuminated.

[Muddy Bog.]

As the elevation drops to the west, this muddy bog gives way to a large lake. Clear paths are visible along the walls of the ravine to both the southwest and northwest, venturing to the center of the bog will require careful foot placement to avoid the stagnant pools and deep muck. Walking through the dark waters that pools atop the sludge beneath can prove dangerous for even the most sure-footed hunter.

The shot is a decent blow to the left leg.

Kambralyn fires her green and black feathered ash crossbow at the black marsh alligator!
The shot is a well-delivered blow to the right leg.

The black marsh alligator just died.

Ariella exclaims, "hah! I hit it"

A gleaming suit of holy armor suddenly forms around Clive's body!

Kambralyn strips the black marsh alligator's body.

Orianna slings her detailed unicorn-etched duskwood recurve bow.

Kithrael grins at Ariella.

Kambralyn beams at Ariella.

The wildflowers release a delicate mist which envelops Clive, covering his skin with sparkling dew drops!

The dew upon Clive is quickly absorbed into his skin.

Wisps of shimmering blue mist begin to trail from Kithrael fingertips.

Orianna slowly raises her arms to her sides as she calls out to the spirits of nature.

Elindalian wildflowers begin to blossom all around Muther!

>
You follow Kambralyn west...

[Muddy Bog.]

A well worn path clings to the base of the ravine wall, the riot of reeds and rushes threatening to claim it. Recently laid deer tracks come to an abrupt end at a site of obvious struggle. The bent stalks of marsh grasses indicate the direction the unlucky animal was dragged, with bits of bloody fur littering its path. On the ravine wall, some jokester has written in fading chalk, "No swimming allowed."

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st water crule.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 5 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.
Obvious paths: north* east* southwest* west* northwest*.

Ariella raises her hands to the heavens and calls out to Elindale!

The suit of holy armor about Clive fades away.

Clive fires his emerald inlaid mahogany crossbow at the water crule!
The shot is a decent blow to the torso.
    The water crule is knocked back!

The water crule advances towards Clive.

Orianna fires her detailed unicorn-etched duskwood recurve bow at the water crule!
The shot nearly fumbles.

Kambralyn fires her green and black feathered ash crossbow at the water crule!
The shot is a strong blow to the right arm.
    The water crule is knocked back!

The water crule bites at Clive!
The attack misses.

Orianna fires her detailed unicorn-etched duskwood recurve bow at the water crule!
The shot misses its target.

Kambralyn fires her green and black feathered ash crossbow at the water crule!
The shot is a well-delivered blow to the right arm.
    The water crule is knocked back!
    It stumbles and falls down!
You see Clive move up another 1 UDs!

Shimmering emerald leaves instantly float down from the heavens and begin to swirl about Ariella!

Ariella clasps her hands together and whispers a prayer to Elindale.

Clive fires his emerald inlaid mahogany crossbow at the water crule!
The shot is an exceptional blow to the right leg.

[Muddy Bog.]

A rocky path skirts the base of a sheer limestone cliff. Despite the unstable footing on the loose stone, this path is far quicker than slogging through the dangerous bog. Tiny pebbles click against the trail as they lose their place in the rock wall, leaving small niches in the jagged surface. To the northwest, the size of the fallen rocks is noticeably larger.

This area is illuminated.

[Muddy Bog.]

A finger and a sandaled foot, both cast in stone, lie amongst the rocks and pebbles that have fallen from the cliffside. Kicking aside a few of the smaller pieces of limestone reveals more bits of a shattered statue, her marbled face worn by time into a grim mask. The statue must have been placed in ancient times before the area was flooded.  A broken regal marble huntress statue is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Muddy Bog.]

The rock strewn path gives way to cool, spongy earth as one heads into the bog. Tiny insects with paddle-shaped appendages dance across the surface of some standing water as tall grasses sway to and fro with the breeze. Deep in the bog, a piercing cry is quickly silenced as some unfortunate animal meets its fate by either being swallowed up in the muck or being attacked by the bog's more ferocious creatures.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st water crule.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 5 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al.

[Muddy Bog.]

A well worn path clings to the base of the ravine wall, the riot of reeds and rushes threatening to claim it. Recently laid deer tracks come to an abrupt end at a site of obvious struggle. The bent stalks of marsh grasses indicate the direction the unlucky animal was dragged, with bits of bloody fur littering its path. On the ravine wall, some jokester has written in fading chalk, "No swimming allowed."

You follow Kambralyn north...

[Muddy Bog.]

A rocky path skirts the base of a sheer limestone cliff. Despite the unstable footing on the loose stone, this path is far quicker than slogging through the dangerous bog. Tiny pebbles click against the trail as they lose their place in the rock wall, leaving small niches in the jagged surface. To the northwest, the size of the fallen rocks is noticeably larger.

This area is illuminated.

[Muddy Bog.]

A finger and a sandaled foot, both cast in stone, lie amongst the rocks and pebbles that have fallen from the cliffside. Kicking aside a few of the smaller pieces of limestone reveals more bits of a shattered statue, her marbled face worn by time into a grim mask. The statue must have been placed in ancient times before the area was flooded.  A broken regal marble huntress statue is here.

[Muddy Bog.]

A well worn path clings to the base of the ravine wall, the riot of reeds and rushes threatening to claim it. Recently laid deer tracks come to an abrupt end at a site of obvious struggle. [Waterfall.]

The narrow muddy path ends at the edge of a deep blue pool. Overhead, the waters of the forest stream gush out into the frothing river. A gentler cascade trickles down the rock face of the chasm, creating a double waterfall. The hardened mud to one side of the path holds the impressions and footsteps of a struggle that occurred here, and a few scattered scales that were dislodged during the battle are becoming petrified into the surroundings by the deposits from the mist of the double waterfall. [Caersech Forest.]

[Hope's Path.]

The path of four leaf clove shaped flagstones leads past a small clean shack and into a well formed tunnel through the thorn bushes to the east and the Caersech to the west. The small shack is set back from the road, its walls built of a whitewashed birch. A sturdy corral, filled with well-fed horses, stands to the left of the shack. A matched pair of dapple grays stand in front of the shack waiting to take their human baggage to their destination. To the left of the door, behind a small paned window, a beautiful Fir Elf female takes coin and in return, with a charming smile, directs those who have paid their fare into the waiting room.  A small shack, a freshly painted sign, a notice of non-refund, and a small winding stone pathway are here.

[Hope's Path.]

Carefully winding its way up the base of the tree, and wrapping itself around the stairs, a flowering jasmine vine grows tall and lush. Dark scars from a past fire are almost hidden under tufts of fresh growth and moss. A large gap, nearly sixteen feet in distance, rests between the base of a set of stairs and the forest floor. A long moonsilver cord hangs down the side of the tree. If one pulls it, the long Elven rope will descend from above, allowing them to enter the great city of Treehaven. Bright green leaves of clover have begun springing up through the ashy soil in conjunction with soft moss to lend a durable cushion to this well-traveled spot.  Some vine-covered steps circling the tree, a freshly painted wooden sign, a healthy green patch of clover, a flowing marble fountain, some clover shaped stones, some sweet scented flowering jasmine vines, and a long woven moonsilver cord are here.

[Steps.]

The latticework surrounding and covering the spiral staircase is finely crafted. The intertwining beams seem to weave a delicate pattern above you, accenting the view of the forest floor. Soft, new, growth can be seen all over the forest below. A small mound of moss has slowly begun to cover the old inn, creating a fuzzy green mound. A large pile of Elven rope sits near the silent Golem. This creature of Elindale helps defend the city by retrieving the rope that people have pushed down to the forest below. [Gaspar's Grog and Grub.]

Four sturdy walls and a roof of woven branches enclose this small tavern. From the forest floor, winding their way around the trunk of the Mother Tree, a set of intricately railed steps serve as the entrance and exit of the town of Treehaven. Strangers arriving at the top of the steps find themselves under the watchful eye of patrons seated at tables positioned about the light, airy room. A set of oak steps lead up to the new Council chambers.  An ivory inlaid pine bar, a wooden stool, a long weathered wooden bench, a long musty wooden table, some steps circling the tree, some freshly crafted oak steps, an open door, a paper covered posting board, a gilt framed painting on the wall, and an open large straw basket are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Ariella the Anthian (flying 5 feet above ground) and Kithrael the Fir Elf.

[Treehaven, Main Platform]

Firm wooden planks fit snuggly to create the walkway that extends proudly upon the reconstructed supports. The view of the forest to the northwest is quite panoramic. A staircase here seems to have some enchantment, judging by the strange appearance of unicorns, bears and owls on the lower steps. Strange, due to the fact that they don't appear carved, painted, or placed by any hand-made means. It is as if the glyphs grew into the wood itself. Mysterious symbols are scattered throughout the portraits, which shimmer with a golden whisper as they are approached.

[Elindale's Temple.]

Encircling the innards of this tree, these steps coil clock-wise to the top, the entire environment one single living thing. There are no cracks, no signs of building. Tapestries on the wall appear life-like, suspended with no visible attachments.  A breathtaking tapestry is here.

[Elindale's Temple.]

A diminutive niche in the wall provides shelter to a small family of flying squirrels. Just inside sit the young, comfortably settled into the soft bedding the parents have gathered up. A breeze carries their tiny chitters to your ears, revealing that the niche is somehow connected to the outside world as well.  A niche in the wall is here.

[Elindale's Temple.]

A large tapestry lines the outside wall of the passageway, most impressive in that it is not made of fabric, but of vines as tiny as thick hairs, growing in a weave. The delicate shadings of the plants is perfectly natural, and as the eye becomes unfocused, a picture of a diminutive, beautiful maiden sits amongst a foresty background. The wall opposite of this magnificent tapestry is lined with portraits of prominent temple leaders, the colors vibrant, bringing a life-like sense to the frames. The eyes of the maiden in the tapestry seem to follow you, staring directly as you pass, boring into your soul.  A vellum portrait, a canvas portrait, a suede portrait, a wooden framed oil painting, some unfinished portraits, and a carefully painted silk screen are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Ariella the Anthian (flying 5 feet above ground) and Kithrael the Fir Elf.

[Elindale's Temple.]

While the tree appears gigantic from the outside, it still is nothing compared to the impression of being on the inside. Hollow branches large enough to pass a drake branch out here, the surfaces smooth, but in a most curious way. It is apparent that no tools were used to create these passageways, yet there is no evidence to give one the impression that the passageways formed over a long period of time. The branches have grown in this manner intentionally, quite unlike any plantlife found anywhere on the land.

This room is illuminated.

[Treehaven, Oaken Bridge.]

[Treehaven, Main Platform]

Firm wooden planks fit snuggly to create the walkway that extends proudly upon the reconstructed supports. The view of the forest to the northwest is quite panoramic. A staircase here seems to have some enchantment, judging by the strange appearance of unicorns, bears and owls on the lower steps. Strange, due to the fact that they don't appear carved, painted, or placed by any hand-made means. It is as if the glyphs grew into the wood itself. [Gaspar's Grog and Grub.]

Four sturdy walls and a roof of woven branches enclose this small tavern. From the forest floor, winding their way around the trunk of the Mother Tree, a set of intricately railed steps serve as the entrance and exit of the town of Treehaven. Strangers arriving at the top of the steps find themselves under the watchful eye of patrons seated at tables positioned about the light, airy room. A set of oak steps lead up to the new Council chambers.  An ivory inlaid pine bar, a wooden stool, a long weathered wooden bench, a long musty wooden table, some steps circling the tree, some freshly crafted oak steps, an open door, a paper covered posting board, a gilt framed painting on the wall, and an open large straw basket are here.

[Hope's Path.]

Carefully winding its way up the base of the tree, and wrapping itself around the stairs, a flowering jasmine vine grows tall and lush. Dark scars from a past fire are almost hidden under tufts of fresh growth and moss. A large gap, nearly sixteen feet in distance, rests between the base of a set of stairs and the forest floor. A long moonsilver cord hangs down the side of the tree. If one pulls it, the long Elven rope will descend from above, allowing them to enter the great city of Treehaven. Bright green leaves of clover have begun springing up through the ashy soil in conjunction with soft moss to lend a durable cushion to this well-traveled spot.  Some vine-covered steps circling the tree, a freshly painted wooden sign, a healthy green patch of clover, a flowing marble fountain, some clover shaped stones, some sweet scented flowering jasmine vines, and a long woven moonsilver cord are here.

[Hope's Path.]

A matched pair of dapple grays stand in front of the shack waiting to take their human baggage to their destination. To the left of the door, behind a small paned window, a beautiful Fir Elf female takes coin and in return, with a charming smile, directs those who have paid their fare into the waiting room. [Muddy Bog.]

Muddy footprints lead from the deeper waters of the bog up toward the edge of the muck.  Oddly enough, there are no footprints coming the other way, as if some large creature crawled out of the sludge to shore. Tiny winged insects buzz all around you, creating eerie harmonies with their wings. Cypress leaves are scattered all throughout the area, with some floating lazily in the waters and others stuck comically atop mounds of mud.  An open blood-stained lionskin bag and an open enchanting burlap sack are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).
Obvious paths: north northeast east southeast south southwest west northwest.

[Muddy Bog.]

The rock strewn path gives way to cool, spongy earth as one heads into the bog. Tiny insects with paddle-shaped appendages dance across the surface of some standing water as tall grasses sway to and fro with the breeze. Deep in the bog, a piercing cry is quickly silenced as some unfortunate animal meets its fate by either being swallowed up in the muck or being attacked by the bog's more ferocious creatures.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).

[Muddy Bog.]

[Muddy Bog.]

Thick, slimy bubbles emerge to the surface of the deep bog and burst with a sickening sound that startles the prey of a nearby snake into hopping away at the last second. Low-hanging cypress branches shade the already dark waters, making them appear much more sinister than the surrounding bog. Somehow life still must go on here,as the splashing of fish diving beneath the exposed roots of the trees can still be heard.

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

The rock strewn path gives way to cool, spongy earth as one heads into the bog. Tiny insects with paddle-shaped appendages dance across the surface of some standing water as tall grasses sway to and fro with the breeze. Deep in the bog, a piercing cry is quickly silenced as some unfortunate animal meets its fate by either being swallowed up in the muck or being attacked by the bog's more ferocious creatures.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).
Obvious paths: north east southeast south southwest* west northwest.

You follow Kambralyn southeast...


The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

A well worn path clings to the base of the ravine wall, the riot of reeds and rushes threatening to claim it. Recently laid deer tracks come to an abrupt end at a site of obvious struggle. The bent stalks of marsh grasses indicate the direction the unlucky animal was dragged, with bits of bloody fur littering its path. On the ravine wall, some jokester has written in fading chalk, "No swimming allowed."

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).
Obvious paths: north east southwest west northwest*.

You follow Kambralyn east...


The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

As the elevation drops to the west, this muddy bog gives way to a large lake. Clear paths are visible along the walls of the ravine to both the southwest and northwest, venturing to the center of the bog will require careful foot placement to avoid the stagnant pools and deep muck. Walking through the dark waters that pools atop the sludge beneath can prove dangerous for even the most sure-footed hunter.

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

The rock strewn path gives way to cool, spongy earth as one heads into the bog. Tiny insects with paddle-shaped appendages dance across the surface of some standing water as tall grasses sway to and fro with the breeze. Deep in the bog, a piercing cry is quickly silenced as some unfortunate animal meets its fate by either being swallowed up in the muck or being attacked by the bog's more ferocious creatures.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st molting crule.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).
Obvious paths: north east* southeast south southwest west northwest.

Orianna asks Kambralyn, "oh - I'm supposed to be making a good impression?"

[Muddy Bog.]

A finger and a sandaled foot, both cast in stone, lie amongst the rocks and pebbles that have fallen from the cliffside. Kicking aside a few of the smaller pieces of limestone reveals more bits of a shattered statue, her marbled face worn by time into a grim mask. The statue must have been placed in ancient times before the area was flooded.  A broken regal marble huntress statue is here.

[Muddy Bog.]

The bog is less murky at this juncture, with the cleaner waters of the lake cleansing the mud beneath. Kambralyn just picked up some silver coins.
l
[Muddy Bog.]

The bog is less murky at this juncture, with the cleaner waters of the lake cleansing the mud beneath.  Even some silverback fishes feed near some floating logs, their backs arching grafully as they leap out as the baby dragonflies that buzz overhead. The vegetation that covers the logs are noticeably healthier than the scraggly trees that inhabit the rest of the bog.  Some rotting mossy sprout-covered logs and a chain linked steel helm are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).
Obvious paths: east southeast south southwest west.
>
The bluish glow spreads out and soothingly envelops Ariella's body!

The bluish glow upon Ariella's fingertips slowly fades away.

You follow Kambralyn southwest...


The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

A subtle under-current pulls the standing reeds to lean slightly south with their leaves trailing down into the water. A large rock lizard flicks its tongue into the air as it scuttles up onto a large rock in pursuit of its dinner. Parts of the rock seem to move as the lizard abruptly vanishes into its depths. After a brief silence following a large gulping sound, the cacaphony of insects returns to its normal volume.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).
Obvious paths: north northeast* east southeast south southwest west.

You follow Kambralyn west...


The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

Several painted arrow shafts stick up out of the path at crazy angles, suggesting some kind of crude hunter's marker.  Why anyone would want to mark a path through the edge of the bog is anyone's guess. The leafy shoot of an oak tree has a pitiful hold in the ground with its roots almost completely exposed.  A family of beetles has taken residence under its branches and made a hearty meal from the lower leaves.  Some broken blackened acorns are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st black marsh alligator.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).
Obvious paths: northeast east* southeast south.

The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

To the west, the brilliantly clear waters of the lake glitter with schools of leaping silverback fish. The view is a startling contrast to the ominously dark waters that make up the home for the bog's denizens. Even the bird nesting in nearby cypress trees seem depressed when they lean their heads down to clean the mud off their feet. The view east seems darker still as the bog waters deepen into blackness.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).
Obvious paths: north northeast east southeast south southwest west northwest*.
diag all

  You examine Orianna the Anthian...

  You examine Clive the Drag-al...

>
You follow Kambralyn north...


The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

The bog is less murky at this juncture, with the cleaner waters of the lake cleansing the mud beneath.  Even some silverback fishes feed near some floating logs, their backs arching grafully as they leap out as the baby dragonflies that buzz overhead. The vegetation that covers the logs are noticeably healthier than the scraggly trees that inhabit the rest of the bog.  Some rotting mossy sprout-covered logs and a chain linked steel helm are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st water crule and the 2nd water crule.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).
Obvious paths: east southeast south* southwest west.

Orianna fires her detailed unicorn-etched duskwood recurve bow at the water crule!
The shot fumbles!

Kambralyn fires her green and black feathered ash crossbow at the water crule!
The shot is a nearly perfect blow to the right arm.
    The water crule is knocked back!

The water crule advances towards Kambralyn.

The 2nd water crule advances towards Kithrael.

Kithrael's fingertips begin to glow with a pale green light.

Clive gestures his hands over the ground and begins to chant.

Beams of pure white light begin to gather within Ariella's uplifted hands.

Kambralyn fires her green and black feathered ash crossbow at the water crule!
The shot is a decent blow to the head.
    The water crule is knocked back!
    It stumbles and falls down!

Orianna fires her detailed unicorn-etched duskwood recurve bow at the water crule!
The shot misses by a slim margin.

The water crule's skin pales as the green light spreads across the surface of its body!

The pale green glow upon Kithrael's fingertips fades away.

The water crule bites at Kithrael!
The attack is a well-delivered blow to the torso.

The 2nd water crule claws at Kithrael!
The attack is a strong blow to the torso.

Kithrael's fingertips begin to glow with a pale green light.

Wisps of smoke rise from the water crule's body.

The earth rumbles as barbed vines shoot out of the ground and lash at the water crule!

The barbed vines fall limp and quickly wither away.

invo ht at ki

You follow Kambralyn south...


The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

To the west, the brilliantly clear waters of the lake glitter with schools of leaping silverback fish. The view is a startling contrast to the ominously dark waters that make up the home for the bog's denizens. Even the bird nesting in nearby cypress trees seem depressed when they lean their heads down to clean the mud off their feet. The view east seems darker still as the bog waters deepen into blackness.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st water crule.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).
Obvious paths: north* northeast east southeast south southwest west northwest.

The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

A subtle under-current pulls the standing reeds to lean slightly south with their leaves trailing down into the water. A large rock lizard flicks its tongue into the air as it scuttles up onto a large rock in pursuit of its dinner. Parts of the rock seem to move as the lizard abruptly vanishes into its depths. After a brief silence following a large gulping sound, the cacaphony of insects returns to its normal volume.

The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

Travel through the deep-bog is rather difficult at this section as the thick, sludgy water is as high as a human's waist. Some fallen, rotting logs jut up from underneath, providing needed handholds. Glittering yellow eyes sparkle for a brief moment in a low branch of the cypress trees.  A twisted mossy oak tree stump is here.

The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

A furry, raccoon-like animal scrambles to free his back legs from the mud and get back into the cleaner fishing waters.  A lizard drowsing on some nearby rocks watches the animal's movements intensely, twitching its tail. The path that snakes around the the east is hard to make out, making it easy to wander toward the deeper waters if one is not careful.  An open delicate bearskin pouch is here.

The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

To the west, the brilliantly clear waters of the lake glitter with schools of leaping silverback fish. The view is a startling contrast to the ominously dark waters that make up the home for the bog's denizens. Even the bird nesting in nearby cypress trees seem depressed when they lean their heads down to clean the mud off their feet. The view east seems darker still as the bog waters deepen into blackness.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st water crule.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).
Obvious paths: north northeast east southeast south southwest west northwest*.

The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

Muddy footprints lead from the deeper waters of the bog up toward the edge of the muck.  Oddly enough, there are no footprints coming the other way, as if some large creature crawled out of the sludge to shore. Tiny winged insects buzz all around you, creating eerie harmonies with their wings. Cypress leaves are scattered all throughout the area, with some floating lazily in the waters and others stuck comically atop mounds of mud.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).
Obvious paths: north northeast east southeast south southwest west* northwest.

Kithrael sits down.
You have no apparent injuries, but look fatigued.

[Muddy Bog.]

Muddy footprints lead from the deeper waters of the bog up toward the edge of the muck.  Oddly enough, there are no footprints coming the other way, as if some large creature crawled out of the sludge to shore. Tiny winged insects buzz all around you, creating eerie harmonies with their wings. Cypress leaves are scattered all throughout the area, with some floating lazily in the waters and others stuck comically atop mounds of mud.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st molting crule corpse.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf (seated), and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).
Obvious paths: north northeast east southeast south southwest west northwest.

The little sparrow returns and sings a pleasant song for Orianna.  The sparrow tweets happily, then flies off again.

[Muddy Bog.]

Travel through the deep-bog is rather difficult at this section as the thick, sludgy water is as high as a human's waist. Some fallen, rotting logs jut up from underneath, providing needed handholds. Glittering yellow eyes sparkle for a brief moment in a low branch of the cypress trees.  A twisted mossy oak tree stump is here.

[Muddy Bog.]

To the west, the brilliantly clear waters of the lake glitter with schools of leaping silverback fish. The view is a startling contrast to the ominously dark waters that make up the home for the bog's denizens. Even the bird nesting in nearby cypress trees seem depressed when they lean their heads down to clean the mud off their feet. The view east seems darker still as the bog waters deepen into blackness.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st molting crule.

l
[Muddy Bog.]

Muddy footprints lead from the deeper waters of the bog up toward the edge of the muck.  Oddly enough, there are no footprints coming the other way, as if some large creature crawled out of the sludge to shore. Tiny winged insects buzz all around you, creating eerie harmonies with their wings. Cypress leaves are scattered all throughout the area, with some floating lazily in the waters and others stuck comically atop mounds of mud.  A moonsilver oil lamp and an oak shafted bronze scythe are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, Kithrael the Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).
Obvious paths: north northeast east southeast south southwest west northwest.
