[Muddy Bog.]

The murky waters of the bog deepen here, and continue to do so to the east, making any movement on foot a sluggish task. Scraggly moss dangles from low hanging cypress trees, providing as yet another obstacle to overcome within the murk. Insects chirp and trill from every angle, almost disguising the low baying of a strange animal nearby; a threat or a warning?  Some stooped cypress trees and some low hanging moss are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Muddy Bog.]

Travel through the deep-bog is rather difficult at this section as the thick, sludgy water is as high as a human's waist. Some fallen, rotting logs jut up from underneath, providing needed handholds. Glittering yellow eyes sparkle for a brief moment in a low branch of the cypress trees.  A twisted mossy oak tree stump is here.

This area is illuminated.

In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).
Obvious paths: north northeast east southeast south southwest* west northwest.

[Muddy Bog.]

Travel through the deep-bog is rather difficult at this section as the thick, sludgy water is as high as a human's waist. Some fallen, rotting logs jut up from underneath, providing needed handholds. Glittering yellow eyes sparkle for a brief moment in a low branch of the cypress trees.  A twisted mossy oak tree stump is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st molting crule corpse, the 1st black marsh alligator corpse, and the 2nd black marsh alligator.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (seated and holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).
Obvious paths: north northeast east southeast south southwest west northwest.

[Muddy Bog.]

Travel through the deep-bog is rather difficult at this section as the thick, sludgy water is as high as a human's waist. Some fallen, rotting logs jut up from underneath, providing needed handholds. Glittering yellow eyes sparkle for a brief moment in a low branch of the cypress trees.  A twisted mossy oak tree stump is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st molting crule corpse, the 1st black marsh alligator corpse, and the 2nd black marsh alligator.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (seated and holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).

[Muddy Bog.]

Travel through the deep-bog is rather difficult at this section as the thick, sludgy water is as high as a human's waist. Some fallen, rotting logs jut up from underneath, providing needed handholds. Glittering yellow eyes sparkle for a brief moment in a low branch of the cypress trees.  A twisted mossy oak tree stump, a blackened steel glaive, and a short platinum headed throwing hatchet are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st molting crule.

[Muddy Bog.]

A subtle under-current pulls the standing reeds to lean slightly south with their leaves trailing down into the water. A large rock lizard flicks its tongue into the air as it scuttles up onto a large rock in pursuit of its dinner. Parts of the rock seem to move as the lizard abruptly vanishes into its depths. After a brief silence following a large gulping sound, the cacaphony of insects returns to its normal volume.

The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

Several painted arrow shafts stick up out of the path at crazy angles, suggesting some kind of crude hunter's marker.  Why anyone would want to mark a path through the edge of the bog is anyone's guess. The leafy shoot of an oak tree has a pitiful hold in the ground with its roots almost completely exposed.  A family of beetles has taken residence under its branches and made a hearty meal from the lower leaves.  Some broken blackened acorns are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st molting crule, the 2nd molting crule, the 1st black marsh alligator, and the 1st water crule.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Ariella the Anthian (flying 5 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).
Obvious paths: northeast east* southeast south.

The earth rumbles as barbed vines shoot out of the ground and lash at the black marsh alligator!

The barbed vines fall limp and quickly wither away.

Ariella's fingertips begin to glow with a soft white light.

Kambralyn fires her green and black feathered ash crossbow at the black marsh alligator!
The shot is a good blow to the right leg.

Clive gestures his hands over the ground and begins to chant.

The molting crule advances towards Clive.

The 2nd molting crule turns and runs southeast!

The black marsh alligator turns and runs south!

The water crule advances towards Kambralyn.

The soft white light spreads out and gently envelops your body!

h
You feel healthier!

The white glow upon Ariella's fingertips slowly fades away.
You have a tiny slash across your left leg, a tiny slash across your right leg, and look weakened and tired.

[Muddy Bog.]

A subtle under-current pulls the standing reeds to lean slightly south with their leaves trailing down into the water. A large rock lizard flicks its tongue into the air as it scuttles up onto a large rock in pursuit of its dinner. Parts of the rock seem to move as the lizard abruptly vanishes into its depths. After a brief silence following a large gulping sound, the cacaphony of insects returns to its normal volume.

[Muddy Bog.]

Thick, brown sludge covers the path through the bog, making it easy to see the tracks of various animals and bootheels of hunters that have passed through here. The soft splut-splut sound of bog toads chasing after dragonflies comes from the bog's edge.

This area is illuminated.

[Muddy Bog.]

The murky waters of the bog deepen here, and continue to do so to the east, making any movement on foot a sluggish task. Scraggly moss dangles from low hanging cypress trees, providing as yet another obstacle to overcome within the murk. Insects chirp and trill from every angle, almost disguising the low baying of a strange animal nearby; a threat or a warning?  Some stooped cypress trees and some low hanging moss are here.

[Muddy Bog.]

The murky waters of the bog deepen here, and continue to do so to the east, making any movement on foot a sluggish task. Scraggly moss dangles from low hanging cypress trees, providing as yet another obstacle to overcome within the murk. Insects chirp and trill from every angle, almost disguising the low baying of a strange animal nearby; a threat or a warning?  Some stooped cypress trees and some low hanging moss are here.

[Muddy Bog.]

A rotting log, home to several winged insects, spans a large pool of murky water that lies between the limestone walls of the ravine. It looks stable enough to support a significant amount of weight, and judging by the air bubbles that rise to the surface of the murky water at regular intervals, it is probably best to keep ones extremities above the water level in this boggy marsh.  A long rotting log is here.

[Muddy Bog.]

Thick, slimy bubbles emerge to the surface of the deep bog and burst with a sickening sound that startles the prey of a nearby snake into hopping away at the last second. Low-hanging cypress branches shade the already dark waters, making them appear much more sinister than the surrounding bog. Somehow life still must go on here,as the splashing of fish diving beneath the exposed roots of the trees can still be heard.

This area is illuminated.

[Muddy Bog.]

Muddy footprints lead from the deeper waters of the bog up toward the edge of the muck.  Oddly enough, there are no footprints coming the other way, as if some large creature crawled out of the sludge to shore. Tiny winged insects buzz all around you, creating eerie harmonies with their wings. Cypress leaves are scattered all throughout the area, with some floating lazily in the waters and others stuck comically atop mounds of mud.

[Muddy Bog.]

A finger and a sandaled foot, both cast in stone, lie amongst the rocks and pebbles that have fallen from the cliffside. Kicking aside a few of the smaller pieces of limestone reveals more bits of a shattered statue, her marbled face worn by time into a grim mask. The statue must have been placed in ancient times before the area was flooded.  A broken regal marble huntress statue is here.

[Muddy Bog.]

The rock strewn path gives way to cool, spongy earth as one heads into the bog. Deep in the bog, a piercing cry is quickly silenced as some unfortunate animal meets its fate by either being swallowed up in the muck or being attacked by the bog's more ferocious creatures.

The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

A well worn path clings to the base of the ravine wall, the riot of reeds and rushes threatening to claim it. Recently laid deer tracks come to an abrupt end at a site of obvious struggle. The bent stalks of marsh grasses indicate the direction the unlucky animal was dragged, with bits of bloody fur littering its path. On the ravine wall, some jokester has written in fading chalk, "No swimming allowed."

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Owynn the Fir Elf, Autumn the Fir Elf, Ariella the Anthian (flying 5 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).

The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

To the west, the brilliantly clear waters of the lake glitter with schools of leaping silverback fish. The view is a startling contrast to the ominously dark waters that make up the home for the bog's denizens. Even the bird nesting in nearby cypress trees seem depressed when they lean their heads down to clean the mud off their feet. The view east seems darker still as the bog waters deepen into blackness.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Owynn the Fir Elf, Autumn the Fir Elf, Ariella the Anthian (flying 5 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).
Obvious paths: north northeast east southeast* south southwest west northwest.

You follow Kambralyn northwest...


The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

A furry, raccoon-like animal scrambles to free his back legs from the mud and get back into the cleaner fishing waters.  A lizard drowsing on some nearby rocks watches the animal's movements intensely, twitching its tail. The path that snakes around the the east is hard to make out, making it easy to wander toward the deeper waters if one is not careful.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st black marsh alligator.

[Muddy Bog.]

The bog is less murky at this juncture, with the cleaner waters of the lake cleansing the mud beneath.  Even some silverback fishes feed near some floating logs, their backs arching grafully as they leap out as the baby dragonflies that buzz overhead. The vegetation that covers the logs are noticeably healthier than the scraggly trees that inhabit the rest of the bog.  Some rotting mossy sprout-covered logs are here.

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

A subtle under-current pulls the standing reeds to lean slightly south with their leaves trailing down into the water. A large rock lizard flicks its tongue into the air as it scuttles up onto a large rock in pursuit of its dinner. Parts of the rock seem to move as the lizard abruptly vanishes into its depths. After a brief silence following a large gulping sound, the cacaphony of insects returns to its normal volume.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Owynn the Fir Elf, Autumn the Fir Elf, Ariella the Anthian (flying 5 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).

[Muddy Bog.]

Several painted arrow shafts stick up out of the path at crazy angles, suggesting some kind of crude hunter's marker.  Why anyone would want to mark a path through the edge of the bog is anyone's guess. The leafy shoot of an oak tree has a pitiful hold in the ground with its roots almost completely exposed.  A family of beetles has taken residence under its branches and made a hearty meal from the lower leaves.  Some broken blackened acorns are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Muddy Bog.]

A furry, raccoon-like animal scrambles to free his back legs from the mud and get back into the cleaner fishing waters. [Muddy Bog.]

To the west, the brilliantly clear waters of the lake glitter with schools of leaping silverback fish. The view is a startling contrast to the ominously dark waters that make up the home for the bog's denizens. Even the bird nesting in nearby cypress trees seem depressed when they lean their heads down to clean the mud off their feet. The view east seems darker still as the bog waters deepen into blackness.

This area is illuminated.

[Muddy Bog.]

The rock strewn path gives way to cool, spongy earth as one heads into the bog. Tiny insects with paddle-shaped appendages dance across the surface of some standing water as tall grasses sway to and fro with the breeze. Deep in the bog, a piercing cry is quickly silenced as some unfortunate animal meets its fate by either being swallowed up in the muck or being attacked by the bog's more ferocious creatures.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Owynn the Fir Elf, Autumn the Fir Elf, Ariella the Anthian (flying 5 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).

[Muddy Bog.]

A rocky path skirts the base of a sheer limestone cliff. Despite the unstable footing on the loose stone, this path is far quicker than slogging through the dangerous bog. Tiny pebbles click against the trail as they lose their place in the rock wall, leaving small niches in the jagged surface. To the northwest, the size of the fallen rocks is noticeably larger.

This area is illuminated.

[Muddy Bog.]

rem spik
A well worn path clings to the base of the ravine wall, the riot of reeds and rushes threatening to claim it. Recently laid deer tracks come to an abrupt end at a site of obvious struggle. The bent stalks of marsh grasses indicate the direction the unlucky animal was dragged, with bits of bloody fur littering its path. On the ravine wall, some jokester has written in fading chalk, "No swimming allowed."

[Muddy Bog.]

The rock strewn path gives way to cool, spongy earth as one heads into the bog. Tiny insects with paddle-shaped appendages dance across the surface of some standing water as tall grasses sway to and fro with the breeze. Deep in the bog, a piercing cry is quickly silenced as some unfortunate animal meets its fate by either being swallowed up in the muck or being attacked by the bog's more ferocious creatures.  A closed sturdy leopardskin sack is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st black marsh alligator corpse.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Owynn the Fir Elf, Autumn the Fir Elf, Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).
Obvious paths: north east southeast south southwest west northwest.
>
Orianna says, "and lots of jugs of whiskey"

Owynn slings his ancient heartwood crossbow.

Owynn readies a short bone handled moonsilver woodsman's knife.

Kambralyn just placed some giant alligator hide within her open large hemp woven bag.
l n
[Muddy Bog.]

A finger and a sandaled foot, both cast in stone, lie amongst the rocks and pebbles that have fallen from the cliffside. Kicking aside a few of the smaller pieces of limestone reveals more bits of a shattered statue, her marbled face worn by time into a grim mask. The statue must have been placed in ancient times before the area was flooded.  A broken regal marble huntress statue is here.

This area is not illuminated.
Obvious paths: north southeast south* southwest west northwest.
>
Autumn says to Ariella, "thanks for all the energy"
l w
[Muddy Bog.]

Muddy footprints lead from the deeper waters of the bog up toward the edge of the muck.  Oddly enough, there are no footprints coming the other way, as if some large creature crawled out of the sludge to shore. Tiny winged insects buzz all around you, creating eerie harmonies with their wings. Cypress leaves are scattered all throughout the area, with some floating lazily in the waters and others stuck comically atop mounds of mud.

This area is not illuminated.
Obvious paths: north northeast east* southeast south southwest west northwest.
l e
>[Muddy Bog.]

A rocky path skirts the base of a sheer limestone cliff. Despite the unstable footing on the loose stone, this path is far quicker than slogging through the dangerous bog. Tiny pebbles click against the trail as they lose their place in the rock wall, leaving small niches in the jagged surface. To the northwest, the size of the fallen rocks is noticeably larger.

This area is not illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast south southwest west* northwest.
l s
>[Muddy Bog.]

Long tendrils of dark green moss drape from hanging branches. The curtain of ancient cypress obscures the view deeper into the bog. Brushing them aside only reveals more cypress and stringy moss. Strange birds call to each other from deep within the trees, but the most that can be seen are a few ruddy feathers.

This area is not illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast east south southwest west northwest.
>
Ariella ponders.

[Muddy Bog.]

The sparkling lake and the slowly eroding limestone cliff wall meet at this northeast corner of the bog. Dark, twisted vegetation is visible upon the high cliff, but a darkened structure looms high above the foliage atop its lofty precipice. Even at a distance, dark scars are evident upon the stone walls of the crumbling structure.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st black marsh alligator.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Owynn the Fir Elf, Autumn the Fir Elf, Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).

[Muddy Bog.]

To the west, the brilliantly clear waters of the lake glitter with schools of leaping silverback fish. The view is a startling contrast to the ominously dark waters that make up the home for the bog's denizens. Even the bird nesting in nearby cypress trees seem depressed when they lean their heads down to clean the mud off their feet. The view east seems darker still as the bog waters deepen into blackness.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st black marsh alligator.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Owynn the Fir Elf, Autumn the Fir Elf, Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).
Obvious paths: north northeast* east southeast south southwest west northwest.

The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

A furry, raccoon-like animal scrambles to free his back legs from the mud and get back into the cleaner fishing waters.  A lizard drowsing on some nearby rocks watches the animal's movements intensely, twitching its tail. The path that snakes around the the east is hard to make out, making it easy to wander toward the deeper waters if one is not careful.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st black marsh alligator.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Owynn the Fir Elf, Autumn the Fir Elf, Ariella the Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).

[Muddy Bog.]

The bog is less murky at this juncture, with the cleaner waters of the lake cleansing the mud beneath.  Even some silverback fishes feed near some floating logs, their backs arching grafully as they leap out as the baby dragonflies that buzz overhead. The vegetation that covers the logs are noticeably healthier than the scraggly trees that inhabit the rest of the bog.  Some rotting mossy sprout-covered logs are here.

The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

Several painted arrow shafts stick up out of the path at crazy angles, suggesting some kind of crude hunter's marker.  Why anyone would want to mark a path through the edge of the bog is anyone's guess. The leafy shoot of an oak tree has a pitiful hold in the ground with its roots almost completely exposed.  A family of beetles has taken residence under its branches and made a hearty meal from the lower leaves.  Some broken blackened acorns are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st water crule corpse.

[Muddy Bog.]

A subtle under-current pulls the standing reeds to lean slightly south with their leaves trailing down into the water. A large rock lizard flicks its tongue into the air as it scuttles up onto a large rock in pursuit of its dinner. Parts of the rock seem to move as the lizard abruptly vanishes into its depths. After a brief silence following a large gulping sound, the cacaphony of insects returns to its normal volume.

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

The bog is less murky at this juncture, with the cleaner waters of the lake cleansing the mud beneath.  Even some silverback fishes feed near some floating logs, their backs arching grafully as they leap out as the baby dragonflies that buzz overhead. The vegetation that covers the logs are noticeably healthier than the scraggly trees that inhabit the rest of the bog.  Some rotting mossy sprout-covered logs and an open blood-stained lionskin sack are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Owynn the Fir Elf, Autumn the Fir Elf, Ariella the Anthian (flying 10 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).
Obvious paths: east southeast south southwest* west.

You follow Kambralyn southeast...


The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

A finger and a sandaled foot, both cast in stone, lie amongst the rocks and pebbles that have fallen from the cliffside. Kicking aside a few of the smaller pieces of limestone reveals more bits of a shattered statue, her marbled face worn by time into a grim mask. The statue must have been placed in ancient times before the area was flooded.  A broken regal marble huntress statue is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Orianna the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above ground), Owynn the Fir Elf, Autumn the Fir Elf, Ariella the Anthian (flying 10 feet above ground), Kambralyn the Noble Fir Elf, and Clive the Noble Drag-al (holding a flaming rag wrapped wyvern bone).

[Muddy Bog.]

Muddy footprints lead from the deeper waters of the bog up toward the edge of the muck.  Oddly enough, there are no footprints coming the other way, as if some large creature crawled out of the sludge to shore. Tiny winged insects buzz all around you, creating eerie harmonies with their wings. [Muddy Bog.]

Muddy footprints lead from the deeper waters of the bog up toward the edge of the muck.  Oddly enough, there are no footprints coming the other way, as if some large creature crawled out of the sludge to shore. Tiny winged insects buzz all around you, creating eerie harmonies with their wings. Cypress leaves are scattered all throughout the area, with some floating lazily in the waters and others stuck comically atop mounds of mud.  A large radiant green crystal, a large ivory charm, a small enchanting black pearl, and some silver coins are here.

[Hope's Path.]

Carefully winding its way up the base of the tree, and wrapping itself around the stairs, a flowering jasmine vine grows tall and lush. Dark scars from a past fire are almost hidden under tufts of fresh growth and moss. A large gap, nearly sixteen feet in distance, rests between the base of a set of stairs and the forest floor. A long moonsilver cord hangs down the side of the tree. If one pulls it, the long Elven rope will descend from above, allowing them to enter the great city of Treehaven. Bright green leaves of clover have begun springing up through the ashy soil in conjunction with soft moss to lend a durable cushion to this well-traveled spot.  Some vine-covered steps circling the tree, a freshly painted wooden sign, a healthy green patch of clover, a flowing marble fountain, some clover shaped stones, some sweet scented flowering jasmine vines, and a long woven moonsilver cord are here.

[Gaspar's Grog and Grub.]

Four sturdy walls and a roof of woven branches enclose this small tavern. From the forest floor, winding their way around the trunk of the Mother Tree, a set of intricately railed steps serve as the entrance and exit of the town of Treehaven. Strangers arriving at the top of the steps find themselves under the watchful eye of patrons seated at tables positioned about the light, airy room. A set of oak steps lead up to the new Council chambers.  An ivory inlaid pine bar, a wooden stool, a long weathered wooden bench, a long musty wooden table, some steps circling the tree, some freshly crafted oak steps, an open door, a paper covered posting board, a gilt framed painting on the wall, and an open large straw basket are here.

This room is illuminated.
